title: Domaine la Castille 2017 Ortega (Var)
description: For a Provence rosé, this juicy wine is deeply colored, which reflects the extra-generous flavors. Soft and fruity, it's ripe with red fruits cut refreshingly with acidity. Drink now.

title: Domaine Terre de Mistral 2017 Anna Vermentino (Côtes de Provence)
description: Named after two grandmothers, one Italian and one Spanish, this yellow and citrus-fruit-flavored wine is ripe while also crisp. Its acidity is embedded in the mineral, tangy texture, giving the wine both freshness and rich fruitiness. Drink now.

title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2017 Légende  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: This wine has concentration, with ripe baked-apple and creamy flavors. Its acidity balances with the lively white fruits and taut mineral texture. Drink now.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2015 Merlot (Finger Lakes)
description: This is a smooth and supple Merlot that offers a mix of red plum, blackberry and a mild leafy, herbal twang. Its mildly grippy tannins and soft acidity lend to its easy-drinking appeal.

title: Dr. Konstantin Frank 2017 Dry Pinot Noir Rosé (Finger Lakes)
description: Aromas and flavors of watermelon and strawberry make for an easily enjoyable wine. While light in body, there's a nice presence of fruit on the palate, with a refreshing lemon backdrop.

title: Duca di Saragnano 2014 Riserva  (Chianti)
description: This straightforward red opens with earthy aromas of game, dark-skinned berries and tilled soil. The medium-bodied palate offers Marasca cherry and tobacco flavors alongside loose-knit tannins. Drink soon.

title: Dürnberg 2017 Getränk Grüner Veltliner (Weinland Österreich)
description: Slightly muddied lemon and pear notes on the nose lead to a fresh easy light palate. They are joined by that characteristic whiff of white pepper and a savory edge of sage. The finish is totally refreshing.

title: Familia Colombi 2014 Reserva Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Oily aromas of walnut and peach pit announce a mature Chardonnay that's in surprisingly good shape. Salty apple and salted butter flavors are yeasty and a touch oxidized, which isn't a shock given that this was bottled in 2014. Despite showing some age, this is round and steady on the finish. Drink now.

title: Ferraton Pere et Fils 2016 Samorëns White (Côtes du Rhône)
description: There's a slightly coppery tone to this savory but easy-drinking, full-bodied white. Its rustic apple and pear flavors have a pleasantly cidery edge, accented by hints of earth and dried herbs. Fresh acidity brightens the finish. Drink now.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2017 Château Grand Escalon Rosé (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Initial smoke and earth scents fade with aeration here. It's a full-bodied, silky wine with delicate raspberry and red cherry accents. The finish is brisk but bright, augmented by hints of dried Mediterranean herbs. Drink now.

title: Gabriel Meffre 2017 La Châsse Prestige Rosé (Côtes du Rhône)
description: While its sour cherry and raspberry flavors are delicate, this is a revitalizing dry rosé. Full bodied yet spry in acidity, it finishes brisk and clean. Drink now.

title: Geografico 2016  Chianti Colli Senesi
description: This wine's subtle plum and baking spice aromas waft out of the glass. The simple, accessible palate delivers black cherry, star anise and green peppercorn notes alongside round tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Glen Manor 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Virginia)
description: This wine has enticing aromas of lemon, white peach and aloe which translate onto the palate. The acidity is crisp but could stand a little more to hold up to the body. The lovely flavors hang on until the very end of a long finish.

title: Governor's Bay 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: This wine has all the extroverted qualities of New Zealand's most famous wine style—brash aromas of guava, grapefruit, passionfruit, grass, tomato leaf and fresh green beans. It has zippy acidity and just a hint of creamy texture, with tons of citrusy zing.

title: HammerSky 2017 Rosé of Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling of a Zinfandel rosé is very darkly hued, showing aromas of dark berries, cola and plum. There is decent zip to the sip, with heavy flavors of berry, plum skins and darker spices.

title: Hazlitt 1852 Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Condensed red- and black-berry aromas are met with tones of fresh herbs and pepper. The palate shows a good progression of ripe fruit, nuanced by sweet herb and astringent black pepper. The medium-grained tannins linger on the finish with a dusting of cocoa.

title: Helix by Reininger 2014 Pomatia Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Syrah (39%) and Cabernet Sauvignon (36%) take the lead on this wine, with the balance Merlot (18%) and Cabernet Franc. The aromas bring appeal, with notes of plum, wheat and assorted dried herb. The flavors are plump in feel but still elegant, wanting a bit more tannic structure to fully stand them up. Blue-fruit flavors linger on the finish.

title: Highland Valley 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Juicy and fruity aromas of blackberry jam, black plum, purple flowers and a savory hint of soy show on the nose of this bottling from a San Diego winery that sourced fruit from Paso. It hits the palate with power, showing Concord grape and dark-berry flavors. But it's quite ripe despite judicious acidity and tannins.

title: Höpler 2017 Grüner Veltliner (Burgenland)
description: Juicy yellow-pear notes dominate the nose. The light dry palate has lemon freshness and the merest touch of sage.

title: Kestrel 2013 Winemaker's Select Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Yakima Valley)
description: The aromas are fresh, with notes of whole green pepper, dark cherry, cocoa and wisps of vanilla and other oak spices. There's a lot of smoothness to the fruit flavors, which lean into the savory, with abundant green-pepper flavors that taper toward the cranberry and spice-filled finish.

title: Knapp 2016 Unoaked Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes)
description: Bright and vibrant on the nose in spiced cranberry and blackberry, there's a hint of green herb in the background of this wine. Having seen no time in oak, this light-bodied wine is all about fresh, racy currant and cranberry flavors, with a graphite edge to offer support.

title: Lasorda Family WInes 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A strong rocky minerality drives the nose of this bottling by the family of former Dodgers manager Tommy Lasorda, but there are also hints of smoke and dried blueberry. The palate is fairly light in tannins and mouthfeel, showing boysenberry, crushed rock and marjoram flavors.

title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2017 Les Papilles Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Light and fruity, this wine offers crisp acidity over red-currant flavors. It's balanced, tangy with a refreshing aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Llano Estacado 2016 Mont Sec Rosé (Texas)
description: Aromas of white grape juice, yellow peach and ruby grapefruit introduce this luscious rosé. Yellow cherry and white peach flavors are struck against white pepper and beachgrass on the palate. The polished finish introduces some stony flavors while bitter lime marks the close.

title: Lornano 2016 Riserva  (Chianti Colli Senesi)
description: Made from 100% Sangiovese, this opens with exotic spice, French oak and black plum aromas that carry over to the taut, tight palate, along with prune and sour cherry notes. Grainy tannins leave a firm, rather astringent finish.

title: Maison Bertrand Ravache 2017 Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence  (Bordeaux Blanc)
description: For pure, young Sauvignon Blanc, this is a soft, rounded wine. It is attractive to drink immediately, with quince, apple and lemon flavors. The final taste is packed with fruit.
designation: Les Hauts de la Gaffelière Sélection d'Excellence

title: Marlborough Estate Reserve 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Notes of stone fruit, watermelon and passionfruit carry a slightly green tinge. There's a ripeness to the feel, but a nice line of acidity helps maintain balance. Overall, a solid and straightforward buy.

title: Merry Cellars 2014 Seven Hills Vineyard Carmenère (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Raw, sliced banana pepper, ground black-pepper, cinnamon and green-herb aromas lead to plump front-loaded cherry and pepper flavors that don't entirely stay together throughout. Cranberry notes linger on the finish.

title: Merryvale 2015 Silhouette Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Given 16 months in French oak, half of it new, this is an oaky, buttery and intensely full-bodied wine, thick and rich in baked apple and brioche flavors.

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has a very deep color. Ample aromas of blackberry and boysenberry jam are followed by flavors that are rich and ripe. It's concentrated and fruity while staying rather low in acidity and soft in terms of tannin.
